params.name: environment_id
params.description: 如果已管理主机，且数值不是从主机组中继承，则需填写。

params.description: 如果使用附带 DHCP 代理服务器的子网则不需要

params.name: mac
params.description: 如果管理的主机为裸机则需要填写，如果为虚拟机，则不需要。

params.description: 如果已管理主机，且数值不是从主机组中继承，则需填写。

params.description: 如果已管理主机，且数值不是从主机组中继承，则需填写。

params.name: medium_id
params.description: 如果不是基于置备的映像，且用于管理主机，同时数值不是来自主机组，则需要填写。

params.name: pxe_loader
params.validator: Must be one of: None, PXELinux BIOS, PXELinux UEFI, Grub UEFI, Grub UEFI SecureBoot, Grub2 UEFI, Grub2 UEFI SecureBoot.

params.name: ptable_id
params.description: 如果已管理主机，且未定义自定义分区，则需填写。

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: 如果已管理主机，且数值不是从主机组中继承，则需填写。

params.name: root_pass

params.name: host_parameters_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: provision_method
params.description: 用来设置主机的方法。provision_methods 可能为 build (基本网络), image (基础介质)

params.name: managed
params.description: 用来表示主机被管理或没有被管理的 True/False 标签。注：这个值还决定是否需要一些参数。

params.name: progress_report_id
params.description: 用来跟踪业务流程任务状态的 UUID，GET /api/orchestration/:UUID/tasks

params.name: interfaces_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: mac
params.description: 接口的 MAC 地址。在裸机中管理的接口需要这个地址。

params.name: domain_id
params.description: 接口的 Foreman 域 ID。所管理主机中的主接口需要这个选项。

params.name: identifier
params.description: 设备标识符，例如：eth0 或者 eth1.1。

params.name: managed
params.description: 这个接口应由 DHCP 管理还是由 DNS 智能代理服务器管理？是否应在预配过程中对其进行配置？

params.name: primary
params.description: 是否应该使用这个接口构建该主机的 FQDN？每台管理的主机都需要有一个主接口。

params.name: provision
params.description: 这个接口是否应该用于 PXELinux 的 TFTP（或基于映象主机的 SSH）？每台管理的主机需要有一个预配接口。

params.name: provider
params.description: 接口提供者，例如 IPMI。仅用于 BMC 接口。

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN 标签，这个属性优先于子网 VLAN ID。仅用于虚拟接口。

params.name: attached_to
params.description: 这个接口所属接口识别符，例如：eth1。仅用于虚拟接口。

params.name: mode
params.description: 接口的捆绑模式，例如：balance-rr。仅用于捆绑接口。

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: 附加接口的识别符，例如：['eth1', 'eth2']。对于捆绑的接口，那些是从属接口。仅用于捆绑和桥接接口。
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: 使用空格分隔的选项，例如：miimon=100。仅用于捆绑接口。

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: 该接口的附加计算资源具体属性。

params.name: kickstart_repository_id
params.description: Repository Id associated with the kickstart repo used for provisioning

domains.name: Domains
domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are of the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

lifecycle_environments.name: Lifecycle environments
lifecycle_environments.full_description:
Description

An environment is a basic organization structure that groups hosts, products, repositories, etc. Every host belongs to one environment and it’s isolated inside so that it can see only content that is in its environment.

Chains

Environments are ordered into chains and their content (propducts, repositories, tempaltes, packages) can be moved to an environment only from its prior environment. You can have for example chain like:

Library -> Development -> Testing -> Production

Each change in an environment is done through a changeset in an action called promotion.

Library

Library is a special environment that has no ascendant: All the content starts in this environment. More chains can start from the library environment but no further branching of a chain is enabled.

params.description: 如果只看到库环境则设定为 true

params.description: 只过滤包含这个名称的环境

params.name: prior_id
params.description: ID of an environment that is prior to the new environment in the chain. It has to be either the ID of Library or the ID of an environment at the end of a chain.

params.name: new_name
params.description: 要分配给这个环境的新名称

params.description: The associated permission type. One of (readable | promotable) Default: readable
